Authors: Kui Han, Yan-Ling Ji, Yong Wang, Zhi-Wei Wang
Title:
A Neotyphodium endophyte from Chinese native Festuca myuros
L. plants grown in Nanjing indicates their anamorphic relatives
Journal: Mycology: An International Journal on Fungal Biology
Keywords:
Festuca myurosï¼Neotyphodium sinofestucae, morphological
properties, phylogenetics
Abstract:
Some Festuca species are infected by seed-transmitted
Neotyphodium fungi without significant pathogenic symptom. Fungal
isolates were obtained from Festuca myuros L. grown in Nanjing. The
endophyte infection level was estimated as high as 91.4% in 148 plant
samples from different sites, indicating endophyte infection is popular
in F. myuros grown in Nanjing. Morphological characteristics of all 11
isolates were identical with each other, and similar with those of
Neotyphodium spp.. Phylogenetic analysis based on tefA and tubB loci
indicated that this fungal isolates clustered with Neotyphodium
sinofestucae, a previous reported species harbored in Festuca parvigluma
Steud.. These fungal endophyte from F. myuros in China was then
identified as Neotyphodium sinofestucae. Tiny difference in
morphological features and close evolutionary relationship in tefA and
tubB information were demonstrated between isolates from these 2
different host species. This exhibit a different evolutionary pathways
in Neotyphodium spp. and fungal diversity of grass endophytes in Festuca
spp..
